public class ProtocolUtils
extends de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.chiffre.BigIntegerUtils

This class provides some special methods for BigInteger arithmetic that are useful for certain cryptographic algorithms.

Fields inherited from class de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.chiffre.BigIntegerUtils

Method Detail

ID

public static java.math.BigInteger ID(java.lang.String I,
                                      int j,
                                      java.math.BigInteger max)
Hashes an identification string I and an integer j to a BigInteger of [0, max - 1], i.e. [0, 2^(max.bitLength () - 1) - 1] where max / 2 < 2^(max.bitLength () - 1) = 2^( [lb(max)] ) <= max
Parameters:
I - an identification string
j - an integer
max - a BigInteger
Returns:
a hash value of [0, max - 1]

crt

public static java.math.BigInteger crt(java.math.BigInteger d1,
                                       java.math.BigInteger d2,
                                       java.math.BigInteger x1,
                                       java.math.BigInteger x2)
This routine yields a solution to the Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT), as described in Algorithmus 3.4. This special case describes the application with t=2.
Parameters:
d1 - a BigInteger
d2 - a BigInteger
x1 - a BigInteger
x2 - a BigInteger
Returns:
x of [0, (d1*d2)-1] solving x mod di = xi for i=1,2

sqrtMod

public static java.math.BigInteger sqrtMod(java.math.BigInteger val,
                                           java.math.BigInteger modulus)
See ALGORITHMS 5.2.1. Calculate the square root of val modulo modulus. modulus must be a prime number, and val a quadratic remainder. Then, an x out of [1, ..., modulus-1] is calculated with x**2 mod modulus = a mod modulus.
Parameters:
val - a BigInteger that is to be square rooted.
modulus - a BigInteger.
Returns:
a square root of val
